ml.classifier.dt
Class AttributeDelegate

java.lang.Object
  ml.classifier.dt.AttributeDelegate
Direct Known Subclasses:
ContinuousAttributeDelegate, DiscreteAttributeDelegate
public abstract class AttributeDelegate
extends java.lang.Object

A delegate of an attribute, containing some essential processed information about the attribute to speed up the tree building process.

Author:
Ping He, Xiaohua Xu
See Also:
DiscreteAttributeDelegate, ContinuousAttributeDelegate

evaluate

protected abstract float[] evaluate(int first,
                                    int last,
                                    AttributeDelegate classAttributeDelegate)
Evaluate the Gain and splitInfo value for the specified data when it splits on the attribute.

Parameters:
first - the begin (inclusive) index of the data to be evaluated
last - the end (exclusive) index of the data to be evaluated
classAttributeDelegate - the delegate of the class attribute. It helps when computing data's class distribution.
Returns:
The evaluation result
See Also:
GainCalculator

groupForward

protected abstract int groupForward(int first,
                                    int last,
                                    int groupBranch,
                                    float[] branchDistri)
Group the data with the specified branch value forward and compute its branch weight.

Parameters:
first - the begin (inclusive) index of the data to be grouped
last - the end (exclusive) index of the data to be grouped
groupBranch - For discrete attribute, the branch index to be grouped; For continuous attribute, -1 for missing data, otherwise the rank of the cut value.
branchDistri - Actually an output of this method, recording the weight of each branch.
Returns:
The boundary index before which the specified data is grouped

groupBackward

protected abstract int groupBackward(int first,
                                     int last)
Group the data with missing value on the attribute backward.

The reason for grouping missing data backward is to narrow the grouping range for the next branch.

Parameters:
first - the begin (inclusive) index of the data to be grouped
last - the end (exclusive) index of the data to be grouped
Returns:
The boundary index after which the data is grouped

getBranchCount

protected abstract int getBranchCount()
Get the number of branches if the attribute is selected as the test attribute.

When an attribute is selected as the test attribute, missing value is not taken as a valid branch value.

getClassBranch

protected int getClassBranch(int caseIndex)
Get the branch index of the class attribute value of the specified data.

Only supported by discrete attribute delegates.
Only used by class attribute delegate.

Parameters:
caseIndex - the index of the specified data
Returns:
The branch index of the class value of the specified data.
See Also:
DiscreteAttributeDelegate.getClassBranch(int caseIndex)

findCutRank

protected int findCutRank(int splitRank,
                          int preSplitRank)
Find the rank of the cut value in the test attribute.

Only supported by continuous attribute delegates.

Parameters:
preSplitRank - the begin (inclusive) rank from which the search of cut should start
splitRank - the end (inclusive) rank to which the search of cut should stop
Returns:
The rank of the cut value
See Also:
ContinuousAttributeDelegate.findCutRank(int splitRank, int preSplitRank)

findCut

protected float findCut(int cutRank)
Find the cut value of the test attribute when provided with its rank.

Only supported by continuous attribute delegates.

Parameters:
cutRank - the rank of the cut
Returns:
The cut value of the test attribute
See Also:
ContinuousAttributeDelegate.findCutRank(int splitRank, int preSplitRank)
